sect2.title: Installation of Bash
sect2.para: Bash needs a static ncurses library that goes by the name of libcurses.a. Some distributions provide this file under the name of libncurses.a. If this is the case of your distribution, run the following two commands to fix the problem:

If the make install phase ends with something along the lines of

blockquote.screen: install-info: unknown option `--dir-file=/mnt/lfs/usr/info/dir' usage: install-info [--version] [--help] [--debug] [--maxwidth=nnn] [--section regexp title] [--infodir=xxx] [--align=nnn] [--calign=nnn] [--quiet] [--menuentry=xxx] [--info-dir=xxx] [--keep-old] [--description=xxx] [--test] [--remove] [--] filename make[1]: *** [install] Error 1 make[1]: Leaving directory `/mnt/lfs/usr/src/bash-2.04/doc' make: [install] Error 2 (ignored)

sect2.para: then that means that you are probably using Debian, and that you have an old version of the texinfo package. This error is not severe by any means: the info pages will be installed when we recompile bash dynamically in chapter 6.
